title: City Patch
segmentation: Hello everyone everyone.
Thank you for invitation.
My name is Michelle and I'm representing studio now and I will tell you a few words about the city Patch idea.
Almost everything was said so.
I will go further.
So the idea is we call it to Sioux City Patch and we defined it.
Looking at the cities because there there is still in modern cities, especially in the big ones, there is still big problem with unused space.
The space there is a lot of space which are problematic, forgotten, empty, neglected or covered by Infinity investments or just fenced.
And those spaces reduce the usable space of the city.
The spaces are still empty because of no concept for them, but mainly we think that the reason of it is the lack of money.
So the this is this game of the the idea.
That's why we propose to deal with those holes with cheap.
And easy to construct and expand and quick to implement solutions.
So the idea is mainly to give those spaces back to the people because now they are not public spaces or common spaces, they are just spaces in the city.
We we are giving the ideas to to solve specific designs after on site analyzes and public consultations and it's a very important part of the process for for us and after that we are giving.
Individual solutions.
And what I need to say is that the design idea that the project came straight from the.
From questions and the answers which we get and from analyzers, and almost always, those solutions are very simple design.
Almost no design.
I can say because we are not focusing on the statics we are trying to focus on simple solutions of the problem.
We always propose temporary solutions right now with of course possibility to convert and to permanent.
Or of course, if it doesn't work, just two quick disassembly.
We strongly believe that the temporary architecture is in them anomic Lee developing society and the cities is the best solution for now.
And one more thing is that as architects we often are afraid of experimenting because we know that our work is.
Has a permanent character.
That's why we propose to input changes in small steps.
With cheap and simple solutions and we think that we should test them first and then put something permanent we're working.
In different type of scales.
From the small interventions to changing some big existing structures.
And now I will tell you a few words about the project, which we realized.
With the Museum of Architecture, about four year and a half ago.
Here you can see that this the concrete steps close to the riverfront in Broadsoft.
And they are in very crowded place, close to the city centre and to the Old Town.
And for now they have not for now, before they had no function.
And they are just a neglected and.
This is the solution.
So it.
It's like this, and as I said before.
Very, very important thing was to to analyze the situation.
The physics of those stairs, but the context urban context too.
And we proposed this kind of solution.
It's.
Just as you can see, those stairs were very bad to sit on them, but the.
Angle of the end about the slope of those stairs were really nice to put a bag of the chairs on on it and to lay on them.
So we proposed this kind of solution where you can see.
And those half chairs helps, and that's even in two person.
And this is how it looks.
And the sun was operating on this place.
Very nice so it was too important to to propose this kind of this kind of function.
And some projects from the medium.
Scale this on.
This is only the idea we are not working only with empty spaces.
We are trying to to work with some spaces where we can find offensive and in practical architecture, especially where you are looking onto so crowded place like this.
These are there some very popular, unfortunately.
In Poland one story, garages and the context was really important.
But first I will show you the.
Our idea so because for now we cannot demolish this those garages.
They are there in on the private plot.
So we propose to put something which will not harm.
The existing place.
And which?
Could work as a as a tourist for summer and spring months.
The context, as usual in our work is very important because on the other side of the street.
Now is very popular spot in the city where is a lot of restaurants and cafes.
So we thought that.
This space will be a good solution for people which are.
Sitting in those restaurants and cafe to city on this kind of Tyrus or it could be a garden two or even some kind of a beach.
Another project from medium scale which we realized on the end of last year we call it a waiting space.
This is very popular and very important crossroad in Russell.

Very crowded too and a lot of people are meeting there and waiting for each other or waiting for public transport because we have a lot of stops close to this close Ro Crossroads and as you can see on the picture there is a small.
In strange triangular green space with useless phone boosts and electricals boxes which are really ugly, so if everyone is waiting there and this space is looking like this, we propose to.
Covered it with something like steps because it's not steps, but much more like a Tribune or just a place where you can comfortably comfortably sit and wait for.
The.
For someone else or or just for a trump or a bus.
Yes, it's it's.
Looks like this right now and still as you can see, Magda is sitting on this with this so very warm called because the pictures were taken on winter.
We are still waiting to to test this solution.
We are waiting for better weather so.
Give us a chance.
Nice.
The day before or after.
Yes, it is possible, but it was after our solution.
It was a little bit.
We were afraid that someone will try to come to the building through the window, not for the doors, and so we need to cover it.
But on the other side of the wall there's only stars and they are still have a lot of sunlight, believe me.
The end about the big scale.
Here we are mainly focused on existing buildings and we're trying to renovate them in some simple way.
Here you can find the one here I'm showing to you so you will one more idea.
I idea project only only a concept.
This is where we made this project about two years two years ago.
Now those silos are demolished unfortunately.
And again, it's it's close to two very popular spot in Broadsoft, close to the water for front of the River, and then during the summer.

A lot of people are doing barbecues so a lot of people running their or cycling and on the other side of those fellows right now is huge construction site and they are building huge residential district and we thought that maybe this kind of silos this kind of different characteristic.
Architecture should stay there and should be some kind of public space and inspired by the graffiti which you can see on the bottom of the silos.
This is the section 3D section of the idea.
We thought about vertical museum which will be open 24 hours a day is still open for everyone and it will be a museum.
Or maybe Gallery is better word for street art artists.
And when you are going up or down during those stairs or maybe even elevator you can watch.
And admire those three dots walks which are on the.
On the concrete.
Rules.
This is how it could looks.
And that's almost all I only want to say on the end, that's that's there were only the examples and we're still looking for the city halls and we're trying to put new patches on them, that's all.
Thank you.
